alert.note: Alert for Southeast Harford (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 7:33AM EDT until June 04 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EDT TODAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Southeast Harford County. * WHEN...Until noon EDT today, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...Water is expected to go over the bulkhead at the Havre de Grace Yacht Basin. Minor shoreline inundation up to one foot above ground is possible elsewhere. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides between one half foot and one foot above normal. The next high tides at Havre de Grace are at 10:22 AM this morning and 11:18 PM this tonight. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Chesapeake Bay at Havre de Grace MD MLLW Categories - Minor 4.0 ft, Moderate 5.5 ft, Major 7.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.2 ft, Moderate 3.7 ft, Major 5.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/11 AM 3.9 1.5 0.9 1.0 None 04/11 PM 2.7 0.3 0.9 1.0 None 05/11 AM 4.3 1.9 1.2 1.0 Minor 06/12 AM 2.7 0.3 0.9 1.0 None 06/12 PM 4.0 1.6 0.9 1.0 Minor 07/01 AM 2.4 -0.0 0.6 1.0 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
